title: Wide Range of Constituencies Union Leaders, Business Leaders, and Advocates Applaud President Bidenâ€™s State of the Union Address | The White House
content: President Biden has long believed that we must build the economy from the bottom up and middle out, not the top down. That is why during his State of the Union address, the President spoke directly to working families and communities across the country who have felt left behind. He outlined his economic agenda and how itâ€™s bringing back manufacturing and creating good-paying jobs â€”in infrastructure, semi-conductors, and clean energyâ€”that donâ€™t require a four-year degree.The President also addressed his unity agenda, consisting of four pillars where Democrats and Republicans have come together: beating the opioid crisis, addressing mental health, supporting our veterans, and ending cancer as we know it.A wide range of constituencies, community leaders, business, and union leaders championed the Presidentâ€™s remarks. Hereâ€™s what they are saying:Union and LaborLiz Shuler, President, AFL-CIO: â€œâ€¦ Instead of catering to the wealthy and well-connected, the President declared that workers are Americaâ€™s backbone and good union jobs are the keystone of an economy that works for allâ€¦â€ [Statement, Â 2/07/23]Becky Pringle, President, National Education Association: â€œâ€¦@POTUS understands that every day, educators stand in the gaps for our studentsâ€”and they deserve to be paid like the professionals they are. #SOTUâ€[Tweet, 2/07/23]Brian L. Renfroe, President, NALC:Â â€œNALC applauds President Biden for recognizing that unions are the strength of the American workforceâ€¦â€ [Statement, 02/08/23]Eric Dean, General President, Ironworkers:Â â€œâ€¦ SariaÂ Gwin-Maye, a 34-year journeyman ironworker out Local 44 in Cincinnati, was selected to introduce President Biden earlier this year at the Brent Spence Bridge in Covington, Kentucky, a job supported by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. She had such an impact on the president and the Iron Workers Union she was invited to be a guest of First Lady Jill Biden at tonightâ€™s address.â€ [Statement,Â 02/08/23]Â Jimmy Williams, General President, Painters Union (IUPAT): â€œ In the first two years of the Biden Administration, we have seen what steady leadership and a commitment to workers can do with things like the passage of the Chips and Science Act, the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, and the Inflation Reduction Act.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]John Costa, International President,Â AmalgamatedÂ Transit Union: â€œIn the past two years, President Biden has created more jobs than any other president in American historyâ€¦â€ â€¯[Statement, 02/07/23]Â Kenneth Cooper, International President,Â InternationalÂ Brotherhood of Electrical Workers: â€œIn his State of the Union address last night, President Biden reminded Americans that his administrationâ€™s priority remains working people and building shared prosperity from the bottomÂ upâ€¦â€ [Statement, 02/08/2023]Â Lee Saunders, President, AFSCME:Â â€œWhen President Biden first took office, he pledged to be â€˜the most pro-union president in history.â€™ He is living up to his promiseâ€¦ Biden has also fostered the most labor friendly environment weâ€™ve seen at the federal level in decades.â€ [Statement, 2/7/23]Â Marc Perrone, International President, United Food and Commercial Workers:Â â€œOver the past few years, UFCW members across the country in grocery stores, meatpacking plants, and other essential industries have secured historic raises and badly needed workplace protections thanks, in part, to the work of the Biden administration which prioritized the needs of Americaâ€™s essential workers..â€ [Statement, 02/08/23]Â Â Mary Kay Henry, President, Service Employees International Union: â€œâ€¦ We agree with President Biden â€“ letâ€™s get the job doneâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]National Domestic Workers Alliance: â€œPresident Bidenâ€™s second State of the Union address renewed the administrationâ€™s commitment to investing in our families and our ability to care for one anotherâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Robert Martinez Jr., International President of International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM): â€œIn his State of the Union address and through his actions leading our nation, itâ€™s clear that President Biden shares our vision for helping working Americans build back betterâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Sean McGarvey, President, NABTU:Â â€œâ€¦ President Biden and the 117th Congress laid an extraordinary sustainable foundation that will generate millions of middle-class, family-sustaining careers and protect workersâ€™ healthÂ and wages for years to come.â€Â [Statement, 02/08/23]Â Sean M. Oâ€™Brien, General President, International Brotherhood of Teamsters: â€œPresident Biden is putting the needs of working people at the center of public debate and Congress needs to meet this moment to repair labor laws in this country.â€ [Statement, 02/02/23]Â Sheet Metal,Â Air, Rail, Transportation Union (SMART):Â â€œOn the campaign trail and during his first State of the Union speech last year, President Biden made big promises: substantial infrastructure investment for the first time in decades, the return of manufacturing to America, and an economy that works from the bottom up and the middle out, not the top down. Now, two years after the presidentâ€™s inauguration, we can say that the Biden administration is delivering on those promises.â€Â [Statement, 02/08/23]Â Terry Oâ€™Sullivan, General President, LIUNA: â€œThe Biden Administration is delivering for working men and women through historic investments that are creating good, family-supporting jobs, measures reducing inflation reduction, and record-setting job growth, and wage growth. The strong, proud, and united men, and women of the Laborersâ€™ InternationalÂ Union of North America could not be more grateful to the President for hisÂ commitment to labor rights, good jobs, and protecting our hard-won wagesÂ and benefits.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Tom Conway, President, United Steel Workers Union: â€œThe president fought for a series of legislative victories â€“ including the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, the CHIPS Act, and the Inflation Reduction Act â€“ that led to the creation of more than 11 million jobs, ushered in historically low unemployment rates, and began to rebuild our nationâ€™s infrastructure and supply chains using materials made by American workersâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]United Association of Journeymen and Apprentices of the Plumbing and Pipefitting Industry of the United States: â€œUA members are proud to deliver affordable, reliable, and efficient energy to American families. Thanks to the Biden Administrationâ€™s all-of-the-above energy approach, we will continue our important work and make America energy independent. #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]United Auto Workers: â€œPresident Biden promised to be the most pro-union President in our countryâ€™s history. Two years into his first term, he has made good on his promise time and time again. Under his leadership, Congress passed landmark laws like the Inflation Reduction Act, CHIPS and Science Act, and Bipartisan Infrastructure Lawâ€¦â€ [Statement, 02/08/23]Â Chris Shelton, President, Communication Workers of America: â€œIn his second State of the Union address, President Biden doubled down on his commitment to push for an economic framework that is centered around meeting the needs of working families.â€Â [Statement, 02/08/23]Doug McCarron, President, United Brotherhood of Carpenters: â€œPresident Bidenâ€™s agenda reflects the needs of hard-working Americans â€“ lowering prescription drug costs, investing in American manufacturing, and increasing wages for working families. Our economy is stronger with good, union jobs and corporations that reinvest profits in workers and research, not stock buybacks and offshore tax shelters.â€ [Statement, 02/08/23]D. Taylor, President, UNITE HERE: â€œPresident Bidenâ€™s 2023 State of the Union address focused on ways to make a more just economy and help those who have been left behind by an uneven recovery. Corporations â€” such as the hospitality companies in the industry that we represent â€” see a global pandemic as an opportunity to take advantage.â€ [Statement, 02/08/23]Randi Weingarten, President, American Federation of Teachers: â€œPresident Biden may have been speaking from the U.S. Capitol tonight, but he could have been sitting at any of our kitchen tables, because he spoke from the heart, directly to the American people, particularly to those left behind or who feel invisible.â€Â [Statement, 02/07/23]National Educators Association: â€œWeâ€™re glad @POTUS acknowledged that universal pre-K & kindergarten give kids the foundation they need for a lifetime of learning & success. â€˜If you want America to have the best-educated workforce, letâ€™s finish the job by providing access to preschool for 3- & 4-year-olds.â€™ #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Machinists Union: â€œWe are glad of @POTUSâ€™ continued support for American manufacture and the families that depend on it. Through the Bipartisan CHIPS and Science Act, this administration and its allies in Congress have truly put working people first.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Small BusinessCandace Waterman, President and CEO, Women Impacting Public Policy: â€œOver the last two years, the Biden-Harris Administration has worked with Congress and across the aisle to advance important legislation, including the CHIPS & Science Act and the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law which have collectively authorized billions of dollars for federal contracting and procurement.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Chiling Tong, President and CEO, National Asian Pacific Islander American Chamber of Commerce and Entrepreneurship: â€œNational ACE supports the Presidentâ€™s efforts to â€˜finish the jobâ€™ of building the economy from the bottom up, and reforming the tax code to reward work. We are grateful to the Administration for its continued efforts to combat AAPI hate, including the recent launch of the National Strategy to Advance Equity, Justice and Opportunity for AA and NHPIsâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]John Neuffer, SIA President and CEO: â€œDuring tonightâ€™s State of the Union Address, President Biden highlighted last yearâ€™s historic enactment of the CHIPS and Science Act, a landmark new law that will greatly strengthen Americaâ€™s economy, national security, and semiconductor supply chains.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Justin Nelson, President, National LGBT Chamber of Commerce: â€œLGBT-owned businesses have bounced back strong in the past two years thanks to critical bipartisan investments like the Restaurant Revitalization Fund and the Paycheck Protection Program included in the American Rescue Planâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Karen Kerrigan, President and CEO, Small Business & Entrepreneurship Council: â€œWe agree with President Bidenâ€™s about Americaâ€™s story. It is one of â€˜progress and resilience,â€™ for this is the story of American entrepreneurs and small businessesâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/08/23]Keith Hall, President and CEO, National Association for the Self-Employed: â€œAmericaâ€™s surge in the small business community means we need continued strong bipartisan cooperation in Washington to ensure our small business community is robust and can continue to growâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Rhett Buttle, Founder, Public Private Strategies & Co-Executive Director, Small Business Roundtable: â€œThe past two years have brought historic legislative accomplishments and bipartisan investments that are benefitting small businesses and the communities they serve all over America, including the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, American Rescue Plan, Inflation Reduction Act, and CHIPS and Science Actâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Ron Busby, President and CEO, US Black Chambers, Inc.: â€œThis Administrationâ€™s commitment to ensuring increased opportunity for the business owners in our network underscores the dedication that has gone into the successes of the last two yearsâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Lisa Coppola, Board of Directors Chair-Elect, National Association of Women Business Owners: â€œTonight, during the State of the Union, President Biden discussed bipartisan efforts that have helped strengthen the economy and create more opportunities for women business ownersâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/8/23]Ying McGuire, President and CEO, NMSDC: â€œThe National Minority Supplier Diversity Council (NMSDC) applauds President Bidenâ€™s address to Congress in which he tactically uplifts many concerns that specifically impact historically underserved minority-owned businesses.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Marla Bilonick, NALCABâ€™s President & CEO: â€œAs the President noted in his State of the Union, Americaâ€™s economy is transitioning from economic uncertainty into a soft landing.Â  We are pleased to see historic job creation and robust small business growth. For the first time in modern history, the lowest-paid workers are getting the most significant wage growthâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/7/23]VeteransCommon Defense: â€œOne of the most pro-veteran administrations of our time. Thank you @POTUS for your unwavering advocacy.â€ [Tweet, 2/08/23]Elizabeth Dole Foundation: â€œâ€˜But time and again, Democrats & Republicans came together. Came together to pass one of the most significant laws ever, helping veterans exposed to toxic burn pits.â€™ â€“ @POTUS #sotu2023â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Everyday Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America: â€œLast year, President Biden focused on #BurnPits in his SOTU address. And the largest healthcare bill, the #PACTAct was passed. Now millions of toxic exposed veterans will now get the healthcare and benefits they deserve.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]The American Legion: â€œThe American Legion is pleased that the @WhiteHouse is bringing needed attention to the tragedy of #veteran #suicide.â€ [Tweet, 2/08/23]Travis Akers, Veterans Influencer: â€œâ€™No one should be homeless in America, especially someone who served their country.â€™ â€“ President Biden, SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]VoteVets: â€œThank you @POTUS Biden #SOTU2023â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Asian Americans and Native Hawaiian and Pacific IslandersSung Yeon Choimorrow, Executive Director, National Asian Pacific American Womenâ€™s Forum (NAPAWF): â€ This evening, President Joe Biden highlighted the recent shooting in Monterey Park and reaffirmed his commitment to abortion rights in his State of the Union address. One of President Bidenâ€™s guests at the State of the Union was Brandon Tsay, a 26-year-old hero who prevented the Monterey Park shooter from harming more peopleâ€¦â€[Statement, 2/07/23]Japanese American Citizens League (JACL): â€œLast night, President Joe Biden delivered his second annual State of the Union address. While touching on a number of points, the Presidentâ€™s major message throughout his address were calls to work across the partisan divide and to make significant progress towards meeting the needs of the American people.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Asian American Justice Center: â€œOur communities continue to be devastated by gun violence and much remains to be done to help us heal. We need laws and policies that will keep our communities safe. 77% of Asian Americans agree that we need stricter gun laws. We need action now on gun violence prevention. #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Christine Chen, Co-Founder and Executive Director, Asian Pacific Islander American Vote: â€œOver the last two years, President Joe Biden and the 117th Congress made significant legislative victories that will have long-lasting positive impacts for Asian American and Pacific Islander communitiesâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Gregg Orton, National Director, National Council on Asian Pacific Americans: â€œAs we reflect on the last two years of the Biden-Harris Administration, two truths stand out. First, we have made remarkable progress in recovering from a pandemic that brought with it a crushing economic downturn, as well as a wave of anti-Asian racism that left our community fearful and deeply hurtâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Juliet K. Choi, President and CEO, Asian & Pacific Islander American Health Forum: â€œWe echo President Bidenâ€™s declarations to continue the path forward to expand health care access for all Americans, including protecting reproductive rights and the rights of LGBTQ+ Americans. This also includes support for the Cancer Moonshot, patients and their families, and standing up for seniors.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]National Asian American Chamber of Commerce and Entrepreneurship: â€œNational ACE supports the Presidentâ€™s efforts to â€œfinish the jobâ€ of building the economy from the bottom up, and reforming the tax code to reward work. We are grateful to the Administration for its continued efforts to combat AAPI hate, including the recent launch of the National Strategy to Advance Equity, Justice and Opportunity for AA and NHPIsâ€¦â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Norman Chen, The Asian American Foundation: â€œTAAF is proud of the progress weâ€™ve made and how the U.S. has rebuilt in the aftermath of COVID. Today, we see the revitalization of industries and in our own communities, the strengthening of small businesses.â€ [Statement, 2/8/23]One APIA Nevada: â€œPresident Bidenâ€™s #StateOfTheUnion included: â€“ $35 Cap on Insulin â€“ Protecting #AbortionAccess â€“ Sustainable Energy #InflationReductionAct â€“ Pathway to Citizenship Policies like these will directly support our Asian and Pacific Islander communities in Nevada!â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Latino LeadersFelipe Benitez, Executive Director and Founder of CorazÃ³n Latino: â€œWe are proud that this administration has proven to be a climate ally focused on social and environmental justice. President Biden was confidently able to discuss all of the accomplishments already made by this administration that have laid the foundation for remarkable progress to improve the quality of life for generations of Americansâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/08/23]Frankie Miranda, President, Hispanic Federation: â€œTwo years ago, our country was in the midst of a once-in-a-century pandemic that had killed hundreds of thousands of people, led to an economic downturn, increased unemployment, and shed a bright light on the ugly disparities that exist in our countryâ€¦â€ [Statement, 02/08/23]Janet MurguÃ­a, President and CEO, Unidos US: â€œWe applaud President Bidenâ€™s leadership that has helped Latinos,Â and all Americans, weather the health and economic challenges from the pandemic, begin to rebuild our infrastructure, and create jobsâ€¦â€ [Press Release, 2/08/23]Luis Belen, Chief Executive Officer, National Health IT Collective: â€œâ€¦ NHIT applauds President Biden renewed commitment to bridging the health equity gap through meaningful investments in high-speed internet infrastructure and access, cutting-edge technology, and human capital.â€ [Statement, 02/07/23]MarÃ­a Teresa Kumar, President and CEO of Voto Latino: â€œTonight we saw a president aiming to foster unity between Americans and advocate for an equitable nation, instead of fueling the bigotry, hate, and chaos being pushed by the Republican Partyâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Marla Bilonick, NALCABâ€™s President & CEO: â€œAs the President noted in his State of the Union, Americaâ€™s economy is transitioning from economic uncertainty into a soft landing. We are pleased to see historic job creation and robust small business growth. For the first time in modern history, the lowest-paid workers are getting the most significant wage growthâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Nathalie Rayes, President and CEO, Latino Victory Project: â€œâ€¦Thanks to policies like the Inflation Reduction Act and the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, our economy is strong, and weâ€™re seeing historic economic growth bolstered by a 50-year record low unemployment rate. These policies are also a tremendous benefit for the Latino communityâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]National Hispanic Caucus of State Legislators: â€œWe support @POTUSâ€™s efforts to make Comprehensive Immigration Reform a reality and provide a pathway to citizenship for DREAMers.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Somos Votantes: â€œWhile Republicans work to build an economy that holds us back, President Biden and Democrats are fighting for working people como nosotros. #AmericaWinsWithBiden #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]â€œIn January 2022, Latino unemployment was 10.4%. By November, it was just 3.9%. Hardworking Latinos showed up to elect President Biden, giving him the support he needed to pass his ambitious agenda and put America back to work! #AmericaWinsWithBidenâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Ramiro A. Cavazos, President and CEO, United States Hispanic Chamber of Commerce: â€œHispanic-owned businesses across the country are getting stronger thanks to the generational bipartisan investments made in the past two yearsâ€¦â€Â  [Statement, 2/07/23]LGBTQI+ LeadersJustin Nelson, President, National LGBT Chamber of Commerce: â€œLGBT-owned businesses have bounced back strong in the past two years thanks to critical bipartisan investments like the Restaurant Revitalization Fund and the Paycheck Protection Program included in the American Rescue Planâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Kelley Robinson, President, Human Rights Campaign: â€œTonight, in front of Congress and the nation, President Biden called attention to the campaign of hatred that is driving discriminatory legislation that targets transgender kids in statehouses around the country. Extremist lawmakers are banning best-practice, doctor approved care, kicking kids off sports teams, censoring curriculum and moreâ€¦â€ [Press Release, 2/07/23]Kierra Johnson, Executive Director, National LGBTQ Task Force: â€œPresident Biden did something we do not often seeâ€”he defined the villains. Companies who care more about profits than people and Congresspeople who refuse to seek bipartisan solutionsâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Sarah Kate Ellis, President and CEO, GLAAD: â€œPresident Biden included LGBTQ people in his vision for a more equal, more free and more compassionate country. In re-upping his call for Congress to pass the Equality Act and protect transgender youth, the President is leading by example to expand freedom so no one is left behindâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Equality California: Grateful to see @POTUS call on Congress to #PassTheEqualityAct during the #StateOfTheUnion and protect all LGBTQ+ Americans from discrimination, regardless of the places they call home. [Tweet, 2/08/23]Black LeadersDerrick Johnson, NAACP President and CEO: â€œPresident Biden presented a vision for the future that spoke to many issues that are top-of-mind for Black Americans including police reform, voting rights, bolstering our economy, addressing climate change, and ensuring affordable and accessible health careâ€¦â€ [Quoted in The Hill, 2/07/23]NAACP: â€œThe Infrastructure & Jobs Bill works for Black America to transform generations of economic access, opportunity, and viability within the Black community, allowing Black communities to #thrive and flourish and finally engage in the benefits promised by the American Dream. #SOTU.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]African American Mayors Association: â€œAAMA continues to applaud the historic progress and profound gains of the Biden Administration. We share President Bidenâ€™s optimism about the future of our country and wholeheartedly believe that the state of our union is made stronger by his leadership.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Dr. David J. Johns, Executive Director, National Black Justice Coalition: â€œWe applaud the President for highlighting critical areas the National Black Justice Coalition has advocated for early and often with the administrationâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/08/23]Maya Wiley, The Leadership Conference President & CEO: â€ #POTUS showed up a bipartisan populist who will veto what hurts people. He named critical @civilrightsorg priorities that too many politicians have been attacking. #sotu2023.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Alicia Garza, principal of the Black to the Future Action Fund: â€œLast night, President Biden laid out a vision â€“ and that vision was shaped by Black voters. Weâ€™ve pushed hard, and we know the Administration is listening. We canâ€™t stop now. Itâ€™s time to â€˜finish the jobâ€™ and build the power to translate policy into real progress, felt by each of us in our daily livesâ€¦â€ [Quoted in The Hill, 2/08/23]National Action Network: â€œâ€We must protect the right to vote, not suppress that fundamental right. We honor the results of our elections, not subvert the will of the people. We must uphold the rule of the law and restore trust in our institutions of democracy.â€ â€“ @POTUS #sotu2023.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Sherrilyn Ifill, Former President & Director-Counsel of LDF (NAACP Legal Defense Fund). Sr Fellow, Ford Foundation: â€œThis THREAD of @POTUS interactions for OVER AN HOUR in the chamber AFTER his #SOTU should tell you all you need to know about the stamina, mental acuity & preparedness of Joe Biden for 2024. Wow. Itâ€™s frankly, unbelievable. This must drive his opponents nuts.â€ [Tweet Thread, 2/07/23]Colmon Elridge, Chair of Kentucky Democrats: â€œIâ€™ve never heard a @POTUSreference â€œthe talkâ€ in a #SOTU. My son texted me from his room â€œI hope @JoeBiden talking about that makes us safer.â€ The real estate in a SOTU is prime. That he took a moment to acknowledge the fears of black parents & their children is breathtaking. [Tweet, 2/07/23]Jewish LeadersJonathan Greenblatt, CEO, Anti-Defamation League: â€œAppropriate for @POTUS to highlight rising extremism in #SOTU. To echo his words, we must give all forms of hate no safe harbor. We must all work together to push back against the normalization of hatred.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]National Council of Jewish Women:â€œWeâ€™re with you @POTUS. All Americans deserve reproductive freedom, full stop. #SOTU2023 #JewsforAbortionAccessâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Sheila Katz, CEO, National Council of Jewish Women: â€œRestoring the dignity of work! Yes to sick days! Yes to PAID family and medical leave! Yes to affordable child care! ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘#sotu2023â€³ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Rural LeadersNational Farmers Union: â€œNearly three quarters of farmers and farmworkers say that theyâ€™ve been directly impacted by the opioid epidemic. We comment the @WhiteHouse for recognizing this crisis, pursuing evidence-based prevention, and expanding access to addiction treatment for communities nationwide.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Olga Morales-Pate, CEO, Rural Community Assistance Partners: â€œRCAP agrees â€“ America should be #1 in infrastructure â€“ especially for clean water! We are proud to work with the @WhiteHouse and @EPA to ensure that historic funding from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law reaches underserved rural and indigenous communities. #RuralMatters #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]RuralOrganizing.org: â€œHereâ€™s an excerpt from Bidenâ€™s #SOTU address that will strike a chord with many rural families. This is what our president wants to deliver and we will continue to work with Dems in Congress to make it happen.â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Save the Children U.S.: â€œNo parent should have to drive by a McDonaldâ€™s parking lot so their kid can do their homework online.â€ Couldnâ€™t agree more, @POTUS. Half of rural families report difficulty connecting to high-speed internet. We must ensure kids have access to the tools they need to learn. #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Gender Equity LeadersA Better Balance: â€œNo one should have to sacrifice their economic security in order to care for their health and their loved ones. Thank you @POTUS for calling the paid sick time and #PaidLeaveforAll policies that working families urgently need!â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Alexis McGill Johnson, President, Planned Parenthood Action Fund: â€œThe abortion access crisis is a national public health crisis. We need everyone in a position of power to fight alongside us to protect this essential health care. Tonight, the President did that by speaking emphatically about every person deserving the ability to make their own health care decisions â€” without political interferenceâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Aâ€™shanti F. Gholar, President, Emerge America: Tonight President Joe Biden championed an America resilient in the face of its problems, because when Americans come together to solve our biggest issues, we always emerge strongerâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Care in Action: â€œLetâ€™s give a little more breathing room to millions of caregivers looking after their loved ones. Pass my plan so we support the workers who are doing Godâ€™s work. @POTUS said SUPPORT CARE WORKERS #SOTU2023â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Caring Across Generations: â€œ@POTUS makes it clear: #CareCantWait and *must* be a priority in 2023: â€œLetâ€™s make sure working parents can afford to raise a family with sick days, paid family and medical leave, and affordable child care that will enable millions more people to go to work. #SOTUâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Center for Reproductive Rights: â€œThank you, President Biden (@POTUS) for your commitment to reproductive rights. We look forward to continuing to work with the Biden-Harris administration to protect Americansâ€™ fundamental rights and restore abortion rights nationwide. #AbortionIsEssentialâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Center for Reproductive Rights: â€œThank you, President Biden (@POTUS) for your commitment to reproductive rights. We look forward to continuing to work with the Biden-Harris administration to protect Americansâ€™ fundamental rights and restore abortion rights nationwide. #AbortionIsEssentialâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Dr. Deborah Turner, League of Women Voters: â€œPresident Biden said, â€˜Democracy must not be a partisan issue. It must be an American issue.â€™ We couldnâ€™t agree moreâ€¦â€ Â [Statement, 2/07/23]Family Values Work Network: â€œOur work has an impact! For 20 years, Family Values @ Workâ€™s Network has worked tirelessly to advance paid family and medical leave at the state level and at the federal level. Today marks a continued milestone in our efforts to keep our demands at the forefront of those who have the power to influence and pass legislationâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Girls Inc.: â€œâ€˜Congress must restore the right the Supreme Court took away last year and codify Roe v. Wade to protect every womanâ€™s constitutional right to choose.â€™Â  Thank you, @POTUS #sotu2023â€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Julie Kashen, Director, Womenâ€™s Economic Justice, The Century Foundation: â€œâ€˜Letâ€™s make sure all working families can afford to make a living with #paidsickdays #Paidfamilyleave affordable #childcareâ€™ â€“ @POTUS #SOTU #CareCantWaitâ€ [Tweet, 2/07/23]Kristin Rowe-Finkbeiner, Executive Director and CEO, MomsRising: â€œâ€¦The moms of America know the state of our union can only be strong when the countryâ€™s moms and families are economically secure, we can all access and afford the health care we need â€” including abortion care, our tax policies require everyone to pay their fair share, and our immigration and public safety policies are sound.Â That is the vision President Biden offered the country tonight.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Mini Timmaraju, President, NARAL Pro-Choice America: â€œPresident Biden reaffirmed tonight that his administration will defend abortion rightsâ€”hard stopâ€¦We are grateful for the presidentâ€™s commitment to veto any extreme national bans on abortion that come from MAGA Republicans in Congress, and we look forward to continued collaboration with the administration to restore and expand abortion access.â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]Nancy Northrup, President and CEO, Center for Reproductive Rights: â€œWe thank the First Lady for inviting Amanda Zurawski of Texas as her guest at tonightâ€™s State of Union address, whose tragic experience with the Texas abortion ban highlights the needless suffering taking place in our country because of criminal abortion bansâ€¦â€ [Statement, 2/07/23]NARAL Pro-Choice America: â€œPoliticians should never interfere with our own personal decisionsâ€”thank you @POTUS for making it
